intro: Guatteria willemetiana, commonly known as the Willemetian guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish drupe that contains a single seed. Guatteria willemetiana is often found in humid lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
